text.section: A registration expires on the first August 31 after its effective date unless it is renewed as provided in this section.

At least 1 month before a registration expires, the Commissioner shall mail to the licensee, at the last known address of the licensee:
a renewal application form; and
a notice that states:
the date on which the current registration expires;
the date by which the Commissioner must receive the renewal application for the renewal to be issued and mailed before the registration expires; and
the amount of the renewal fee.

Before a registration expires, the licensee may renew the registration of a representative for an additional 1-year term if:
the representative otherwise is entitled to a registration;
the licensee files with the Commissioner a renewal application on the form that the Commissioner provides; and
the licensee pays to the Commissioner a registration renewal fee of $2.
The Commissioner shall renew the registration of a representative if the licensee and representative meet the requirements of this section.
